definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
at first/suddenly/abruptly/to spread/(of hair) to stand on end/bristling
to blow up/to destroy with explosives

sentences.english: Holidays fried fruit, but also with butter.
sentences.chinese: 逢年过节炸果子，也用酥油。

sentences.english: so it looked like they've been blown apart.
sentences.chinese: 使其看起来像被炸得分裂了一样。

sentences.english: We were bombed out during the Anti-Japanese War.
sentences.chinese: 抗战期间我们被炸得无家可归。

sentences.english: They’ve been fried just enough to be crispy and golden.
Heat wok with oil, deep-fry drumsticks until golden, dish up and drain excess oil, set aside.
sentences.chinese: 烧热油镬，下鸡槌炸至金黄，盛起隔油备用。

sentences.english: Deep-fry the spring rolls until golden.
The explosion blew the bridge to smithereens.
If you want to lose weight，you should go easy on the fried foods.
sentences.chinese: 你想瘦吗，炸的食品你就悠着点吃吧。

sentences.english: If at first you don't fricassee, fry, fry a hen. (RD)
sentences.chinese: 如果开始做不成白汁鸡块，就炸一只鸡试试。

sentences.english: Would you like your chicken grilled or fried?
sentences.chinese: 你点的鸡肉要烤的还是炸的？

sentences.english: You stay beside me; I'll fry the meat in the oil first.
sentences.chinese: 我先把肉炸一下，你站在我旁边。

sentences.english: I had veal cutlets for supper.
The TV also showed images of several water-filled craters caused by the blasts.
sentences.chinese: 电视还播放了一些填满水的被炸弹炸穿的弹孔的画面。

sentences.english: The smell of red pepper being fried irritates the nose.
I fried it first and then boiled it so that it is crisp outside and soft inside.
sentences.chinese: 我先把它炸了，然后又煮，整道菜外脆内嫩。

sentences.english: Deep fried turkeys are boiled at searingtemperatures in up to five gallons of hot oil.
sentences.chinese: 油炸火鸡是放在多达5加仑的热油中用高温炸出来的。

definition: to explode or burst/to quick fry or quick boil
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
to sauté/to stir-fry/to speculate/to hype/to fire (sb)
to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary
